view

Class ElementView

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.ElementView
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ButtonView, CandyView, DoorView, MonsterView, PlayerView

    public abstract class ElementView
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class representing any element that can be represented graphically at a single position. Provides methods to print the element on the screen.
    Author:
    Teiki Pepin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double height
      Double representing the height of the element.
      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView sprite
      ImageView representing the sprite to display for this element.
      private double width
      Double representing the width of the element.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      protected ElementView()
      Constructor for all implementing classes.

      void drawSprite(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane, int x, int y)
      Adds the sprite of this element to the specified pane at the given coordinates.
      private double getDisplayPositionFromXCoord(int x)
      Gives the graphical display coordinate (in number of pixels from origin) on the horizontal axis from a vertex's coordinate in the graph.
      private double getDisplayPositionFromYCoord(int y)
      Gives the graphical display coordinate (in number of pixels from origin) on the vertical axis from a vertex's coordinate in the graph.
      protected abstract java.io.File getImageFile()

      protected javafx.scene.image.ImageView getSprite()
      Getter that returns an ImageView corresponding to the graphical representation of this element.
      void updatePosition(int x, int y)
      Moves the sprite of this element to the given coordinates.
      protected void updateSprite(java.io.File newSpritePath)
      This method updates the stored graphical representation of this object by reading from a file stored on disk.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElementView

        protected ElementView()
        Constructor for all implementing classes. Uses an image file that should be provided by the implementing class.
        See Also:
        getImageFile()

    • Method Detail

      • getImageFile

        protected abstract java.io.File getImageFile()
        Abstract method that should be properly implemented by all inheriting classes. It will be used at initialization to build the graphical representation of this element.
        Returns:
        a File pointing to an image file representing the element
        See Also:
        ElementView()

      • drawSprite

        public void drawSprite(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane,
                       int x,
                       int y)
        Adds the sprite of this element to the specified pane at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        pane - the JavaFX pane in which to draw this element
        x - the x coordinate in the graph at which to draw this element
        y - the y coordinate in the graph at which to draw this element
        See Also:
        Pane

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition(int x,
                           int y)
        Moves the sprite of this element to the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate in the graph at which to move this sprite
        y - the y coordinate in the graph at which to move this sprite

      • getDisplayPositionFromXCoord

        private double getDisplayPositionFromXCoord(int x)
        Gives the graphical display coordinate (in number of pixels from origin) on the horizontal axis from a vertex's coordinate in the graph.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate in the graph
        Returns:
        the x coordinate in the display
        See Also:
        LabyrinthView

      • getDisplayPositionFromYCoord

        private double getDisplayPositionFromYCoord(int y)
        Gives the graphical display coordinate (in number of pixels from origin) on the vertical axis from a vertex's coordinate in the graph.
        Parameters:
        y - the y coordinate in the graph
        Returns:
        the y coordinate in the display
        See Also:
        LabyrinthView

      • getSprite

        protected javafx.scene.image.ImageView getSprite()
        Getter that returns an ImageView corresponding to the graphical representation of this element.
        Returns:
        the ImageView representing the sprite of this element

      • updateSprite

        protected void updateSprite(java.io.File newSpritePath)
        This method updates the stored graphical representation of this object by reading from a file stored on disk.
        Parameters:
        newSpritePath - the File from which the sprite can be read
